intro: Nonea capensis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a sprawling, shrub-like habit. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Nonea capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
